001package nbody;
002
003import edu.princeton.cs.StdDraw;
004
005/******************************************************************************
006 *  Compilation:  javac Body.java
007 *  Execution:    java Body
008 *  Dependencies: Vector.java StdDraw.java
009 *
010 *  Implementation of a 2D Body with a position, velocity and mass.
011 *
012 *
013 ******************************************************************************/
014
015public class Body {
016    private Vector r;      // position
017    private Vector v;      // velocity
018    private final double mass;   // mass
019    private final double size;
020
021    public Body(Vector r, Vector v, double mass) {
022        this.r = r;
023        this.v = v;
024        this.mass = mass;
025        this.size = mass * .00000000000000000000000000000001 + .03;
026    } // Body( Vector, Vector, double )
027
028    public void move(Vector f, double dt) {
029        Vector a = f.times(1/mass);
030        v = v.plus(a.times(dt));
031        r = r.plus(v.times(dt));
032    } // move( Vector, double )
033
034    public Vector forceFrom(Body b) {
035        Body a = this;
036        double G = 6.67e-11;
037        Vector delta = b.r.minus(a.r);
038        double dist = delta.magnitude();
039        double F = (G * a.mass * b.mass) / (dist * dist);
040        return delta.direction().times(F);
041    } // forceFrom( Body )
042
043    public void draw() {
044        StdDraw.setPenRadius(size);
045        StdDraw.point(r.cartesian(0), r.cartesian(1));
046    } // draw()
047
048    // this method is only needed if you want to change the size of the bodies
049    public void draw(double penRadius) {
050        StdDraw.setPenRadius(penRadius);
051        StdDraw.point(r.cartesian(0), r.cartesian(1));
052    } // draw( double )
053
054} // Body
